intro: Ranunculus procurrentiformis, commonly known as the procurrentiform buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and palmately divided leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five to seven sepals that resemble petals, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. The species is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine meadows and forest edges.
